text: [This girl asks such obvious questions.] It's a Cheshire-Cat, and that's why. Pig!
[She knows nothing.] They all can, and most of 'em do.
[This child is infuriating.] You don't know much, and that's a fact.
[These interruptions are tiresome.] If everybody minded their own business, the world would go round a deal faster than it does.
[I've had enough of this.] Talking of axes, chop off her head!
[I must impart my wisdom to this child.] Everything's got a moral, if only you can find it.
[She clearly needs more instruction.] Tut, tut, child! Every thing's got a moral, if only you can find it.
[Another opportunity for a moral!] 'Tis so, and the moral of that is—'Oh, 'tis love, 'tis love, that makes the world go round!'
[She's learning, but still needs guidance.] Ah, well! It means much the same thing, and the moral of that is—'Take care of the sense, and the sounds will take care of themselves.'
[Let me impress her with more wisdom.] The more there is of mine, the less there is of yours.
